body: It may be that Windows does not allow those modes as desktop modes.
Check the [return value of ChangeDisplaySettingsEx](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd183413.aspx). It may tell us more.
`ChangeDisplaySettingsExW()` returned `DISP_CHANGE_BADMODE`, the graphics mode is not supported for all of the 25-30Hz modes.
That's clear enough, then. I'll see if I can prevent GLFW from listing those video modes.
Please see if the `cds-test` branch resolves this issue.
Just tested the `cds-test` branch and ran the monitors test without error.

Cool! Thank you for testing!

Just one more thing: does `glfwInit` in that branch take a long time to complete on your system?
`glfwInit` on that branch takes around 0.012 seconds to complete.
Thank you! I'll go ahead and merge this then.

issue.title: glfwGetVideoModes takes couple seconds

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug reports and bugfix pull requests

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
Hi :)

As in the title. glfwGetVideoModes is taking up to 20 seconds while collecting all videomodes for given monitor. While I have 3 monitors, whole listing process takes one minute ;)

I'll investigate this in a while. My spec: Win10 (10162) x64 . Working on the newest master branch of glfw.
